De Carlostadio agemus hiisce diebus, ut aliquo pacto fieri posset, ut vir tantus locum sibi dignum acquireret.
Vale.
Ex Scaphusia, 19. martii 1532.
Erasmus Ritter ex animo tuus.
Henrico Bullingero, apud Tigurum evangelium Christi constanter adnunctianti, charissimo fratri.
seg.output:
Peace and grace from God through Jesus Christ.
I thank you greatly, my dearest brother, for the excellent gift which has been given to me by Peter, who proclaims the gospel of Christ at the rapids of the Rhine near Zurich. Believe me, this is a most precious gift to me, not only because of its learning and solid piety, but also because it is an undeniable proof of your wonderful love for me. Therefore I would not wish to refuse you anything, but I urge you to persist in your undertaking and to exert yourself to the best of your ability to publish more quickly the things you have been meditating on in the epistle to the Hebrews. Doing so would be not only gratifying to us all, but also of great service to the cause of Christianity.
We shall discuss the matter of Carlstadt in the coming days to see if something can be done to secure a worthy place for such a great man.
Farewell.
From Schaffhausen, 19th March 1532.
Erasmus Ritter, devotedly yours.
To Henry Bullinger, faithfully proclaiming the gospel of Christ in Zurich, my dearest brother.
